sentences.english: Beyond the hedge he pulled on his trunks and fastened them.
sentences.chinese: 他在圍籬外把游泳褲穿上繫緊。

sentences.english: I followed, racing to get into my Sears, Roebuck bathing suit.
sentences.chinese: 我跟在後頭，趕忙去穿我的西爾斯泳褲。

sentences.english: I have two pairs of swimming trunks.
He is wringing out the water from his swimming trunks .
sentences.chinese: 他正在把游泳褲中的水絞出來。

sentences.english: When the feet kick down, the bathing suit comes out of the water every time.
sentences.chinese: 每次向下踢腿時，泳褲就應露出水面。

definition: summer sleeping mat (e.g. of woven split bamboo)/CL:張|张[zhang1],領|领[ling3]
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to like looking attractive (usually of girls)/aestheticism
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to whisper to one another's ear
to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
